2xl.$description: gridSpacing.2xl — 2x large grid gap (48px). Use for: maximum separation in grids, presentation layouts, sparse artistic layouts. Rarely needed - consider if layout needs restructuring.

lg.$description: gridSpacing.lg — Large grid gap (32px). Use for: spacious card layouts, content grids, marketing pages. Good for layouts with larger cards or content blocks.

md.$description: gridSpacing.md — Medium grid gap (24px). Use for: default content grids, spacious card layouts, comfortable dashboard grids. Balances density with readability.

sm.$description: gridSpacing.sm — Small grid gap (16px). Use for: standard card grids, form layouts, compact dashboard grids. Good default for most grid layouts.

xl.$description: gridSpacing.xl — Extra large grid gap (40px). Use for: hero grids, feature showcases, landing page layouts. Creates clear separation between grid items.

xs.$description: gridSpacing.xs — Extra small grid gap (8px). Use for: compact card grids, dense dashboard layouts, mobile-optimized grids, icon grids. Minimum comfortable gap for touch targets.

lg.$description: spacing.lg — Large spacing (20px). Use for: generous padding, separation between related groups, dialog/modal padding, card spacing. Creates breathing room without excessive whitespace.

md.$description: spacing.md — Medium spacing (16px). DEFAULT spacing value. Use for: standard gaps between elements, modal padding, card padding, section padding within components. Most common spacing value in the system.

sm.$description: spacing.sm — Small spacing (12px). Use for: standard component internal padding, form field padding, list item padding, card content padding. Common in: buttons, inputs, dropdowns, list items.

xl.$description: spacing.xl — Extra large spacing (32px). Use for: major section separation, page-level margins, large component padding, hero sections. Creates significant visual separation between unrelated content areas.

xs.$description: spacing.xs — Extra small spacing (10px). Use for: tight padding in compact components, icon-to-text gaps, inline element spacing, dense data tables. Common in: badges, tags, compact buttons, chip components.

2xl.$description: verticalRhythm.2xl — Triple baseline (76.8px). Use for: page section breaks, major content area separations, hero-to-content transitions. Maximum prose spacing - use sparingly.

lg.$description: verticalRhythm.lg — 1.5 baselines (38.4px). Use for: heading top margins, spacing before new sections within content, emphasis breaks. Creates clear topic transitions.

md.$description: verticalRhythm.md — Single baseline (25.6px). DEFAULT prose spacing. Use for: paragraph margins, standard content block spacing, default vertical rhythm. One full line height of separation.

sm.$description: verticalRhythm.sm — Half baseline (12.8px). Use for: heading bottom margins, spacing after inline elements, paragraph-adjacent element spacing. Creates subtle but noticeable separation.

xl.$description: verticalRhythm.xl — Double baseline (51.2px). Use for: major section breaks in prose, chapter-level separations, significant content divisions. Two full line heights of separation.

xs.$description: verticalRhythm.xs — Quarter baseline (6.4px). Use for: list item spacing within tight lists, line spacing adjustments, micro-spacing in prose. Minimal vertical separation.
